habitats: Dry areas with xeric vegetation at about 600 m.
distribution: This species occurs in north-central Argentina in Formosa and Chaco.
soil: Found in regions with sandy soils.

habitats:
Scrub.
Sand dune habitats with grasses (Panicum; Poa).
distribution: This species occurs in south-eastern Buenos Aires Province, Argentina, in a very narrow distribution along the coast.

habitats: Open savanna areas that have been disturbed by different agricultural and cattle grazing activities (http://www.iucnredlist.org).
distribution:
Around the city of Santa Cruz, central Bolivia; Mato Grosso in south-western Brazil; western Paraguay; Formosa Province in Argentina.
In Bolivia it is found at 400–500 m asl.
soil: Colonies are found in areas with friable, not often flooded soils.

distribution:
North eastern Argentina, in Corrientes Province.
Two small outlier localities included in southern portion of the distribution (Bidau and Lessa, pers. comm.).

habitats: Seashore dunes, in an area of high salinity and poor vegetation.
distribution: Endemic to Brazil. Occurs along the south-eastern coast.

habitats:
Arid, steppe grassland punctuated at irregular intervals by wet meadows known as “mallines”.
Its primary habitat is Patagonian Steppe, and it is also found in low Monte and Valdivian rain forest.
distribution: Neuquén, Rio Negro, and Chubut provinces, Argentina; in the Monte de Llanuras and Mesetas ecoregions.

habitats: Found in the vicinity of sand dunes.
distribution: Endemic to southern Brazil, in the state of Rio Grande do Sul.
soil: Inhabits a region with sandy soil named ‘Coxilha das Lombas' in Brazil.

habitats: Dry areas with xeric vegetation at about 600 m.
distribution: North-western Argentina in Tucumán and Salta Provinces.

habitats: Altiplano open grasslands, in both primary habitat and areas disturbed by grazing.
distribution: Altiplano highlands surrounding Lake Titicaca, extending from La Paz, Bolivia, to southern Puno, Peru, between 3,800-4,500 m asl.
soil: Colonies are found in areas with friable soils.

distribution: Endemic to extreme southern South America including southern Chile and southern Argentina.

habitats: Semixeric to xeric habitats with grasses and shrub communities (Larrea sp.).
distribution: Occurs in Argentina on eastern slopes of the Andes from Santa Cruz north to Mendoza provinces, 460-3,400 m asl.
soil: Aridisols. Poorly developed sandy and gravelly soils.

distribution: This species is known for only a few localities in Tucumán Province (Alberdi, Lamadrid, Monteagudo and Simoca), in the Chaco Seco region, Argentina.

habitats: Habitats with sparse vegetation and loose soil.
distribution: Northwest Argentina, south-western Bolivia, southern Peru, northern Chile, 2,500–5,000 m asl on the Andean steppe.
soil: Sandy and gravelly soils, usually on slopes.

distribution: North-eastern Argentina, in the central area of western Corrientes Province.

habitats: The original habitat was Pampas grasslands. Due to changes in land use, it is now mostly found at the edges of fields.
distribution: Eastern Argentina in Buenos Aires and La Pampa Provinces.
soil: Fine sandy soils to slightly gravelly sandy soil (Echeverria, unpubl. data).

habitats: Historically, its natural habitat was Pampas.
distribution: Southern Córdoba and southern San Luis Provinces, Argentina.

habitats: It is restricted to sand dunes (Lessa, pers. comm.).
distribution: South-eastern-most part of Río Negro (Uruguay) between the Río Negro and Río Uruguay. Coast of Río Uruguay in Entre Ríos Province, Argentina.

habitats: Sand dunes and edges of rivers.
distribution: Argentina, near the Paraná River in Corrientes Province. It can be found over an area smaller than 100 km2 (Bidau, pers. comm.)
Only known from the vicinity of the type locality Los Cardones, Tucumán Province, Argentina.

habitats: Arid, steppe grassland punctuated at irregular intervals by wet meadows known as “mallines”.
distribution: Neuquén Province, Argentina, within the area of Reserva Nacional del Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi.
soil: Black soil but extremely light and easy to work with.

habitats: Lives in well vegetated grassy habitats. Inhabits highly variable habitat from sand dunes to inland grasslands.
distribution: Eastern Argentina along the coast in Buenos Aires Province, possibly extending to Santa Fe Province.
soil: Sandy and friable to hard, clayey soils. Some populations inhabit hard soils rich in humus and with low percentage of silt or clay.

habitats:
Scrub, grassland.
Wide range of habitats (Lessa, pers. comm.). Prefers sandy habitats, and in Uruguay it does not occur in cultivated areas.
distribution: From central Uruguay to southern Brazil, in Rio Grande do Sul State.

habitats:
Scrub, grassland.
Humid plains to 3000 m.

soil: Deep humid soils in the piedmont and forest borders of Tucuman city (Contreras, pers. comm.).
